climbs.name: Rimescolare di Bambino
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Jim Phillips (2018)

content.description: Follow the big ramp up and left, then stay left on the slab to the leftmost anchor.
content.location: Start at the base of the big leftward ramp. Shares first 2 bolts with the route to the right.

climbs.name: Peccatore
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Jim Phillips (2018)

content.description: Hop up the good face holds to some nice low angle slab, shying away from the edge up to the anchor.
content.location: Start in a little corner just right of the ledges. First bolt should be obvious.

climbs.name: Mob Mentality
climbs.fa: Viktor Kramar, Sean Woods, Jim Phillips (2018)

content.description: Follow the ramp up, then heave onto the slab above and go straight up and right.
content.location: Start at the base of the leftward ramp. Shares the first 2 bolts with the route to the left.

climbs.name: Meta Grumo
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramar, Jim Phillips (2018)

content.description: Head straight up the easy to grip ledges and onto the face above and the anchors that await.
content.location: Right in the middle of the crag, to the right of the ramp and to the left of the darker section of wall.

content.description: Awkward start with at least left, right, and middle variants, but that's the biggest challenge as this ends up at a lovely anchor ledge with clear views down on the rightmost anchor and its 3 routes.
content.location: Starts in the middle of a dark square of wall, right of middle in the crag but left of the taller dark section.

content.description: Easy edges and ledges to grab makes this a quick run up to the chains. Alternatively you can skootch right after the last bolt and hit the other set of anchors, good for setting up a TR for the last 2 routes.
content.location: Rightmost section of Bambino where the rock is darker than the rest of the crag. This is the leftmost route of the 3 that share this little stretch.

content.description: More ledgy goodness, just head straight up the face and into the anchor!
content.location: Rightmost area on Bambino. Middle route in the darker section of rock.

content.description: Getting tougher as the lower face smooths out and gets vertical, but turns into good edges to cling to as you pull onto the upper slab section. The last bolt before the anchor is shared with the route to the left.
content.location: Rightmost route on Bambino, in the darker section of rock.

content.description: A little scramble to the top of the crag and the first anchor. Only one real move at the top.
content.location: Furthest left route at Bambino, up the obvious ledges.
